ListTopic.summary: Queries the topics that belong to an Alibaba Cloud account. The topics are displayed by page.

schema.description: The page number. Valid values: 1 to 100000000. If you set this parameter to a value smaller than 1, the value of this parameter is 1 by default. If you set this parameter to a value greater than 100000000, the value of this parameter is 100000000 by default.

The number of entries per page. Value values: 10 to 50. If you set this parameter to a value smaller than 10, the value of this parameter is 10 by default. If you set this parameter to a value greater than 50, the value of this parameter is 50 by default.
The name of the topic.
The tags.

schema.description: The name of the queue.
The maximum length of the message that is sent to the queue. Valid values: 1024 to 65536. Unit: bytes. Default value: 65536.

The maximum duration for which a message is retained in the queue. After the specified retention period ends, the message is deleted regardless of whether the message is consumed. Valid values: 60 to 604800. Unit: seconds. Default value: 345600.
The duration for which a message stays in the Inactive state after the message is received from the queue. Valid values: 1 to 43200. Unit: seconds. Default value: 30.
The maximum duration for which long polling requests are held after the ReceiveMessage operation is called. Valid values: 0 to 30. Unit: seconds. Default value: 0

Specifies whether to enable the log management feature. Valid values:

*   true: enabled.
*   false: disabled.

Default value: false.
The period after which all messages sent to the queue are consumed. Valid values: 0 to 604800. Unit: seconds. Default value: 0
The tags.
The dead-letter queue policy.

Enabled.description: Specifies whether to enable the dead-letter message delivery.

DeadLetterTargetQueue.description: The queue to which dead-letter messages are delivered.

GetQueueAttributes.summary: Queries the attributes of an existing queue.

schema.description: The name of the queue.
The tags.

Success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful.

CreateTime.description: The time when the queue was created.

LastModifyTime.description: The time when the queue was last modified. This value is a UNIX timestamp representing the number of milliseconds that have elapsed since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC.

DelaySeconds.description: The period after which all messages sent to the queue are consumed. Unit: seconds.

MaximumMessageSize.description: The maximum length of the message that is sent to the queue. Unit: bytes.

MessageRetentionPeriod.description: The maximum duration for which a message is retained in the queue. After the specified retention period ends, the message is deleted regardless of whether the message is received. Unit: seconds.

VisibilityTimeout.description: The duration for which a message stays in the Inactive state after the message is received from the queue. Valid values: 1 to 43200. Unit: seconds. Default value: 30.

PollingWaitSeconds.description: The maximum duration for which long polling requests are held after the ReceiveMessage operation is called. Unit: seconds.

ActiveMessages.description: The total number of messages that are in the Active state in the queue. The value is an approximate value. Default value: 0. We recommend that you do not use the return value and that you call CloudMonitor API operations to query the metric value.

InactiveMessages.description: The total number of messages that are in the Inactive state in the queue. The value is an approximate value. Default value: 0. We recommend that you do not use the return value and that you call CloudMonitor API operations to query the metric value.

DelayMessages.description: The total number of messages that are in the Delayed state in the queue. The value is an approximate value. Default value: 0. We recommend that you do not use the return value and that you call CloudMonitor API operations to query the metric value.

LoggingEnabled.description:
Indicates whether the logging feature is enabled. Valid values:

*   True
*   False

Subscribe.summary: Creates a subscription to a topic.

schema.description: The name of the topic.
The name of the subscription.

The terminal type. Valid values:

*   http: HTTP services
*   queue: queues
*   mpush: mobile devices
*   alisms: Alibaba Cloud Short Message Service (SMS)
*   email: emails

The receiver endpoint. The format of the endpoint varies based on the terminal type.

*   If you set PushType to http, set Endpoint to an `HTTP URL that starts with http:// or https://`.
*   If you set PushType to queue, set Endpoint to a `queue name`.
*   If you set PushType to mpush, set Endpoint to an `AppKey`.
*   If you set PushType to alisms, set Endpoint to a `mobile number`.
*   If you set PushType to email, set Endpoint to an `email address`.

The retry policy that is applied if an error occurs when Message Service (MNS) pushes messages to the endpoint. Valid values:

*   BACKOFF_RETRY
*   EXPONENTIAL_DECAY_RETRY

The content format of the messages that are pushed to the endpoint. Valid values:

*   XML
*   JSON
*   SIMPLIFIED

The tag that is used to filter messages. Only messages that have the same tag can be pushed. Set the value to a string of no more than 16 characters.

By default, no tag is specified to filter messages.
The dead-letter queue policy.

Enabled.description: Specifies whether to enable the dead-letter message delivery.

DeadLetterTargetQueue.description: The queue to which dead-letter messages are delivered.

Success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful.

Subscribe.title: Subscribe

The dead-letter queue policy.

DisableEndpoint.summary: You can call this operation to disenable the endpoint of a type. After the endpoint is disabled, all requests from the endpoint are blocked and an error is returned.

schema.description:
The type of the endpoint. Value:

*   **public**: indicates an public endpoint. (Only the public endpoint is supported.)

Success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful.

DisableEndpoint.title: DisableEndpoint

EnableEndpoint.summary: You can call this operation to enable the endpoint of a type. If the endpoint is enabled, requests from the endpoint that are included in the access control lists (ACLs) are not blocked.

schema.description:
The type of the endpoint. Valid value:

*   **public**: indicates public endpoint. (Only the public is supported.)

Success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful.

EnableEndpoint.title: EnableEndpoint

schema.description:
The type of the endpoint. Value:

*   **public**: indicates public endpoint. (Only the public is supported.)

Success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful.

EndpointEnabled.description: Specifies whether the endpoint is enabled.

AclStrategy.description:
The ACL policy. Valid values:

*   **allow**: indicates that the current endpoint allows access from the corresponding CIDR block. (Only allow is supported.)

RevokeEndpointAcl.summary: You can call this operation to delete one or more rules of access control lists (ACLs) for the endpoint of a type.

schema.description:
The type of the endpoint. Valid values:

*   **public**: indicates public endpoint. (Only the public is supported.)

The ACL policy. Value:

*   **allow**: indicates that this operation is included in the Cidr whitelist. (Only the allow is supported.)
The list of CIDR block.

Success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful.

RevokeEndpointAcl.title: RevokeEndpointAcl

AuthorizeEndpointAcl.summary: You can call this operation to add one or more rules of access control lists (ACLs) for the endpoint of a type.

schema.description:
The type of the endpoint. Valid values:

*   **public**: indicates public endpoint. (Only the public endpoint is supported.)

The ACL policy. Valid values:

*   **allow**: indicates that this operation is included in the Cidr whitelist. (Only the allow is supported.)
The list of CIDR block.

Success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful.

AuthorizeEndpointAcl.title: AuthorizeEndpointAcl
